text:
GR and HTTP are circularly downgrading each other. Is this normal?
```(@v1.5) pkg> add GR@0.52.0
  Resolving package versions...
Updating `C:\Users\avik\.julia\environments\v1.5\Project.toml`
  [28b8d3ca] + GR v0.52.0
Updating `C:\Users\avik\.julia\environments\v1.5\Manifest.toml`
  [28b8d3ca] ↑ GR v0.49.1 ⇒ v0.52.0
  [cd3eb016] ↓ HTTP v0.9.2 ⇒ v0.8.19
  [5c2747f8] - URIs v1.1.0

(@v1.5) pkg> add HTTP@0.9.2
  Resolving package versions...
Updating `C:\Users\avik\.julia\environments\v1.5\Project.toml`
  [28b8d3ca] ↓ GR v0.52.0 ⇒ v0.49.1
  [cd3eb016] + HTTP v0.9.2
Updating `C:\Users\avik\.julia\environments\v1.5\Manifest.toml`
  [28b8d3ca] ↓ GR v0.52.0 ⇒ v0.49.1
  [cd3eb016] ↑ HTTP v0.8.19 ⇒ v0.9.2
  [5c2747f8] + URIs v1.1.0```

text: try pinning one of them and then `@` adding the other, that should tell you more about what's happening

elements.text: try pinning one of them and then
adding the other, that should tell you more about what's happening

text: GR 0.49.1 doesn't have the dependency on HTTP, so that's why GR is downgraded to allow the explicit requirement of HTTP@0.9.2
